definition: dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
to appear/to come out in the open

sentences.english: Self-revelation is at the same time self-destruction.
sentences.chinese: 自我顯露同時也是自我毀滅。

sentences.english: It is in times of adversities that your true character and qualities are shown.
sentences.chinese: 四面楚歌之時，正是你顯露不凡氣概與特質的機會。

sentences.english: Diazinon and chlorpyrifos, too, were eventually revealed to be hazardous.
sentences.chinese: 二嗪農和毒死蜱也逐漸顯露出危險性。
我不能把恐懼顯露出來。

sentences.english: After they cut through more layers of steel, a hidden trap finally appeared.
sentences.chinese: 又鋸掉了幾層鋼板之後，一個暗藏的玄機終於顯露。

sentences.english: That zealotry first revealed itself when he was a teenager.
sentences.chinese: 這狂熱的第一次顯露了出來，當他是少年。

sentences.english: Just over each temple there were little blue veins .
sentences.chinese: 就在兩鬢太陽穴上面顯露著青色的細小靜脈。

sentences.english: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
sentences.chinese: 愚昧人不喜愛明哲，只喜愛顯露心意。

sentences.english: Choleric people don't cry easily or show much emotion at all.
sentences.chinese: 暴躁的人不會輕易哭泣，或顯露過多的情緒。

sentences.english: I would like to end by thanking God for the small mercies he has shown us at this dreadful time.
sentences.chinese: 感謝上帝在這個可怕的時代向我們顯露的悲憫。

sentences.english: Even as a child he showed an unusual aptitude for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 甚至孩童時他就顯露出非統一般的數學才能。

sentences.english: The person that hides in darkness is many a also show true colour.
sentences.chinese: 藏在黑暗中的人也一個一個的顯露真顏。

sentences.english: Her true motives only emerged later.
sentences.chinese: 她的現實念頭是厥後才顯露的。

sentences.english: This tax inspector was demonstrating one of the most common of human frailties .
sentences.chinese: 這位稽查員，顯露出一種最常見到的人性的弱點。

sentences.english: Only when doing things alone can he show his paces.
sentences.chinese: 只有單幹的時候他才能顯露出自己的真本事。

sentences.english: A wise teacher never shows favouritism.
sentences.chinese: 聰明的老師從不顯露偏心。

definition: to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
